message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique and valuable product. I believe it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to start the conversation with a price of $1,800,000.

Alice, I appreciate your offer, but unfortunately, $1,800,000 is outside my budget. I'm very interested in this product and believe it has great potential. I'd be willing to pay $1,400,000 for it. This is my best offer, and I believe it reflects the product's fair market value.

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob, and I'm glad you see its potential. However, I was hoping to get a bit closer to my target price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $1,600,000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to revisit this price in future negotiations.

Alice, I understand your need to get closer to your target price, but $1,600,000 is still a bit higher than what I can realistically afford. To make this work, I'm willing to offer $1,500,000. This is my final offer, as I'm very close to my budget limit. If this isn't acceptable, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand that you're close to your budget limit, Bob, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I'm not willing to sell the product for $1,500,000, as it's still below my minimum target price. I'm willing to make one more offer, and I'm willing to meet you at $1,600,000, but I need you to commit to this price. If not, I'll have to consider other options.
